Section 1.A: the most suitable for thick vertical vessel.

Section 1.Question: Pick out the wrong statement pertaining to the use of valve tray, seive tray and bubble cap trays in continuous distillation column.
Section 1.A: Bubble cap trays though most expensive are the best in situations, where low vapour rates is to be handled and a positive liquid seal is essential at all flow rates.
Section 1.B: Murphree efficiency of all the three trays are nearly equal, however the peak efficiency is generally higher for seive and valve trays than the bubble cap.
Section 1.C: Maintenance cost for valve and seive trays are comparatively more than bubble cap tray due to their relatively complicated construction features.
Section 1.D: Valve trays have the highest turn down ratio (i.e. the ratio of the highest to the lowest vapour flow rates) and thus provides the maximum flexible operating range.

Section 1.Question: With increase in the number of shell passes, the value of FT
Section 1.D: remains same, only if the number of tube passes does not change.

Section 1.Question: Holes of a sieve tray are arranged in triangular pitch of __________ times the hole diameter.

In a shell and tube heat exchanger, the 'tube pitch' is defined as the
Section 1.A: O.D. of the tube for square pitch.
Section 1.B: shortest distance between two adj acent tube holes.
Section 1.C: shortest centre to centre distance between adjacent tubes.

Section 1.Question: Which of the following is not a valid assumption in continuous binary distillation for calculating the number of equilibrium stages by Mc-Cabe-Thiele's method?
Section 1.A: Sensible heat changes for vapour & liquid are negligibly small.
Section 1.B: Reflux is not a saturated liquid.
Section 1.C: Molar latent heat of the two components are equal.
Section 1.D: Heat of mixing of normal liquid is assumed to be zero.

Section 1.B: velocity of process fluid containing suspended solids.

Section 1.C: facilitate handling of large flow rate of liquid.

Section 1.Question: The operating pressure drop range in a bag filter is about __________ mm water gauge.

Section 1.B: Packed towers are generally preferred over plate towers, if the liquids have a foaming tendency.

Section 1.D: either (a) or (b); depends upon the I.D. of the pipe

Section 1.Question: Pick out the wrong statement pertaining to the design of the bubble cap tray of a distillation column to give stable operation and even vapour distribution.
Section 1.A: The pressure drop due to the caps & slots and the static submergence should be as high as practicable for reasonable operation.
Section 1.B: Tendency towards stable operation is increased by increasing the skirt clearance of the caps, lowering the rate of liquid flow per unit plate width or increasing the spacing between the caps.
Section 1.C: The dimensionless ratio of liquid gradient to pressure drop head caused by the bubble cap assembly should be less than 0.4.

Section 1.D: reducing the resistance of fluid flow.

Section 2.A: practical limit reached, due to low heat transfer rate because of inadequate temperature difference.

Section 2.D: Length of straight rectangular weir on cross-flow tray.

Section 2.Question: Ponchon Savarit method is based on the use of enthalpy concentration diagram, which contains the bubble point curve (saturated liquid curve), dew point curve (saturated vapour curve) and equilibrium tie lines. As compared to McCabe-Thiele's method, this method

Section 2.B: accounts for the enthalpy changes in the process.
Section 2.C: facilitates direct calculation of heat load on reboiler & condenser from, the diagram used in this method.

Section 2.Question: The optimum size ratio for two mixed reactors in series depends on the kinetics of the reaction and the conversion level. For reaction orders more than one, the
Section 2.A: equal sized reactors are the best.

Section 2.A: overall gas transfer units to the number of ideal trays required.

Section 2.Question: Pick out the wrong statement about the design of a sieve plate column.
Section 2.A: An increased weir height improves the tray efficiency at the cost of high plate pressure drop; optimum wear height being 40-90 mm for column pressure above atmospheric and 6-12 mm for vacuum columns.
Section 2.B: For segmental downcomers, the chord length is 60-80% of the column diameter. An initial value of downcomer area of 12% is taken in the design.
Section 2.C: Width of the calming section provided at the inlet and outlet sides of the plate is 75 mm for column diameter below 1.5 metres and 100 mm for larger diameter columns.
Section 2.D: Minimum recommended downcomer residence time for the disengagement of entrained vapour is the same for both foaming and non-foaming liquids, which is about 20 seconds.

Section 2.B: Plate tower is preferred over packed tower, if the operation involves liquids containing dispersed solids.
Section 2.C: The total weight of a dry plate tower is usually much more than that of a dry packed tower designed for the same duty.
Section 2.D: In operations involving large temperature changes. (e.g. distillation), plate towers are preferred over packed towers as the packing may be crushed due to large temperature changes.

Section 3.Question: In a shell and tube heat exchanger, triangular pitch arrangement as compared to square pitch arrangement
Section 3.A: results in higher shell side pressure drop.
Section 3.B: can accomodate less number of tubes for a given shell diameter.
Section 3.C: facilitates easier shell side cleaning; hence is more suitable for handling high dirt factor shell side fluid.
Section 3.D: creates relatively lower turbulence on the shell side resulting in lower shell side heat transfer co-efficient.

Section 3.Question: Pick out the wrong statement about routing of fluids in a shell and tube heat exchanger.
Section 3.A: The corrosive and fouling fluid should be preferably routed through the tubes.
Section 3.B: The viscous fluid should be routed through the shell side.
Section 3.C: Lower flow rate fluid should be routed through the shell side.
Section 3.D: Higher pressure fluid stream should be routed through the shell side.

Section 3.Question: The necessary wall thickness for a metallic storage vessel is a function of the
Section 3.A: ultimate tensile strength (or yield point) of the material and operating temperature.

Section 3.B: In a flanged and shallow dished head, the crown radius is > shell outside diameter.
Section 3.C: Flat head covers are most suitable for larger vessels operating at very high pressure.
Section 3.D: Flanged only head is a type of flat head in which gradual change in the shape at the centre results in reduced local stresses.

Section 3.Question: Pick out the wrong statement pertaining to the design of a horizontal tube evaporator.
Section 3.A: It is unsuitable for concentrating those liquids, which form a scale or deposit salt.

Section 8.B: decreasing the number of rows of caps through which the liquid flows or by decreasing the velocity of liquid flow past the caps or by reducing the distance along the tray through which the liquid must flow.
Section 8.C: using split flow, radial flow or cascade flow for column diameter large than 4 ft.

Section 8.Question: In a shell and tube heat exchanger for a given heat transfer surface area, smaller diameter tubes are favoured as compared to larger diameter ones ; because the smaller diameter tubes
Section 8.C: can be fitted into a smaller shell diameter hence the cost of the heat exchanger would be less.

What is the value of 'q' for saturated vapor feed to a distillation column ?(where q = fraction of the feed stream that is liquid.)
In hydrostatic testing of welded pipe (for leakage, strength etc.) the ratio of minimum hydrostatic test pressure to internal design pressure is around
Frame thickness in the plate and frame filter press is normally in the range of __________ inches.
Cylinderical shell thickness of rotary drier is generally __________ mm.
The ratio of lateral strain to linear strain is termed as the
The distance between the centre of a rivet hole to the nearest edge of the plate is called
Mc Cable Thiele method used for finding theoretical stages in a distillation column assumes that the
Section 8.A: sensible heat differences are small, because the temperature changes from tray to tray is small.
Section 8.C: liquid/vapor loading across the column remains constant.

Section 8.Question: A minimum clearance of about __________ mm is maintained between the distillation column wall and the bubble cap.
Pick out the wrong statement.
Section 8.A: If sufficient residence time (around 8 seconds) is not proivided to the downcoming liquid in the downcomer, it may entrain some vapour.
Section 8.B: The liquid head in the downcomer should not be greater than one half the plate spacing to avoid flooding.
Section 8.C: The dischare end of the downcomer must project far enough into the tray liquid so that no gas bubbles can enter the open end and by pass the bubble caps.

Section 8.Question: Pick out the wrong statement pertaining to shell and tube heat exchanger.
Section 8.A: Clearance between shell & baffles and between tube & baffles should be minimum to avoid by-passing of the fluid, but it should be enough to permit the removal of tube bundle.
Section 8.B: Baffles are supported independently of the tubes by tie rods and positioned by spacers.
Section 8.C: Tie rods are fixed at one end in the tube sheet by making blind holes and the minimum number of tie rods is 4 with at least 10 mm diameter.
Section 8.D: Bracket supports are used for horizontal shell, while saddle support is used for vertical shell.

Section 8.Question: Wind load consideration in the design of a support can be neglected, when the vessel is
Section 8.A: tall (say 30 metres), but is full of liquid.

Section 8.Question: Souders Brown equation given by, https://www.indiabix.com/_files/images/chemical-engineering/process-equipment-and-plant-design/590-379-1.png , is used for the calculation of the __________ in a continuous distillation column.
Section 8.A: diameter of the bubble cap column
Section 8.B: diameter of the seive plate column
Section 8.D: residence time in the downcomer for the disengagement of entrained vapour

Section 8.Question: The ratio of volumes of the mixed reactor to the plug flow reactor (for identical feed composition, flow rate, conversion, and for all positive reaction orders) is always
Section 8.D: equal to the order of reaction
